Sanskrit Line: अस्माकं देशे गङ्गायमुनादयः बह्वयः नद्यः प्रवहन्ति ।
Translation: In our country, many rivers like the Gaṅgā and Yamunā flow.
Every river originates from some mountain.

Sanskrit Line: हिमालयात् गङ्गा निस्सरति कलिन्दगिरेः यमुना प्रादुर्भवति ।
Translation: The Gaṅgā emerges from the Himālaya, and the Yamunā originates from the Kalinda mountain.
Similarly, rivers emerge from their respective mountains.

Sanskrit Line: अत एव कवयः पर्वतानां पुत्रिकाः नद्यः इति व्यवहरन्ति ।
Translation: Therefore, poets refer to rivers as the daughters of mountains.
All these rivers merge into the eastern ocean.

Sanskrit Line: ‘नदीनां सागरो गतिः' इति वचनानुसारं समुद्र एव समस्ताः नद्यः विलीयन्ते ।
Translation: According to the saying "the ocean is the destination of rivers," all rivers ultimately dissolve into the ocean.
